titleLine: ^This game is played by entering text into the textbox (and submitting by enter).

s0: ^You take a while looking at the marvelous title screen.
s1: ^Yes, it is really quite grand. You are excited to see how it plays.
s2: ^Eager to cling to the smallest details you are spending way more time at the title line than the developers expected
s3: ^Like the developers in the game jam, you don't have infinite amount of time to use.

b: ^This brings you fond memories of various closets you have been in.

c-2: ^Created as part of Global Quantum Game Jam 2022
c-3: ^You are supposed to solve a murder and not terminate programs.

startDescription: ^Every journey is a series of choices. The first is to begin the journey.

s: ^Too much curiosity can get the best of us.

c-2: ^Oh, you want an artsy fancy pants indie game.
^A reptilian brain drinks it in like a beer.
^An unimaginably hoarse sound booms what would be all over if there was anything.
^The is no Innocence, not even one with glowing lungs.
^Soon a smile will spring as icon for the ages to keep the ex-wives away.
^It is not sponsored by a mad hatter, not for lack of not being mad enough.
^And definetely not for the tea for not being strong enough.
^The man whose job it is to find the naked truth
^rather escapes trying to sunset his brain into tequila.

s: ^Oh that is a cool game I want to play that
^This is terribly confusing I don't want this

c-0: ^Well you have to get your ass up from the chair if you want to get to that flashy disco.
^The prince has not even set a keeper... clearly anarch lands.

s: ^I shall go embrace that game tonight
^You are being too cryptid for my tastes. I am leaving.

c-1: ^We are going to do this nice and simple.

b: ^I am not going to draw you any more adventure lines.

c-3: ^Some events happen whether we want them to or not.

bedUp: ^You wake up with the strangest feeling as if somebody has departed this earth.

b: ^You feel majestic despite your long life.
^Luckily your day deals with much simpler matters.

bedUp: ^The university comfortability is on your shoulders as its janitor.
^Yesterday performance review gave you a grade of
^Some students were complaining about the toilets.
^Luckily you carry an amble supply of pens with you.

b:
^Well, you try to have lots.

^You seem to be down to only two.

bedUp: ^With days priorities set, time to go earn the next grade.

b: ^There are slices in the left side of the stomach
^A bit bloated, the stomach wiggles as you touch it

^The neck has rope marks on the front.

^It is twisted back, like someone pulled hard
^The angle of the neck provokes great uncomfortability in you in sympathy to the person that is no longer there.
^The red all around the neck does not seem to be blood?
^No more any burdens to carry on those.

protagonist: ^Sometimes you feel so absent minded that you could forget your name.
^Both enrolled and working for the university means having a particularly close relationship to the grounds.

b: ^Lets see what the bright day brings for
^It is a stormy and dark day.
^ fights the wind to reach safety.
^You tought you knew everything but you just learned how the color red looks like.
^The smell of fresh cut grass brightens your mood.

hallway: ^The hallway seems empty. There is a door to the cleaning cellar,
^a door to a classroom, a wide opening to a cafeteria and a door to the auditorium.

b: ^That is funny. I thought I cleaned up this end of the hallway yesterday.

classroom: ^The classroom seems echoing, but there is someone behind a high bookstack
auditorium: ^...except for a lone figure jumping up and down

EnteringBathroom: ^Allways the same old. No sense to be mindful of the floor cause we allways got...
^You watch in horror that the bathroom is already occupied.
^Not by somebody but something that used to be human.
^After coming to terms with reality you discover that the victim has been pierced by red lipstick, a pink page separator and a blue pen.
^This seems like a mystery you need to get to the bottom of.

c-0: ^The blue pen seems elegant. Being used like a sword doesn't compliment its true power.
c-1:
^The separator has torn this poor human from this mortal coil.

^Straw that breaks the camels back and all.
c-2: ^Atleast they went out with a bang. Too bad the party friend didn't stick around to help.
c-4: ^That is not a sight one forgets for some time.
c-5: ^That is not a sight one forgets for some time.

CellarItems: ^On the floor, besides all the bottles of cleaning liquids, brushes and swabs
^is a book with the name "Bernard Tar",
^an earring, a hat and a feather.

b: ^There are not enough feathers to pose a threat to anyones dignity.

c-1: ^The earring seems a spiral made of golden, with a small amethyst in the center.
c-2: ^The hat is brown, with a broad brim.
c-3: ^The feather is large and coloured in brilliant red and blue.

Butler: ^ approaches a calm servant that could be mistaken for a statue, if they would not breathe.
^"You are the one investigating the murder..."
^"...and why have you come to see me?"

c-1: ^"I am to check all relevant personel"

b: ^"Yes, it is good to fullfill our roles well."
^"And you think I am relevant to the murder?"

c-2: ^"Death comes for us all and I am here to check that you didn't invite it prematurely"
^"With that kind of attitude you should be investigating yourself"

c-0: ^"So where were you when the murder took place?"

b: ^"Supervising that the cooks implemented the seasoning request"
^"My master was a very well established person."
^"My, ehm, Master, was a very well established person."

c-2: ^"It isn't exactly serving if you cause your masters demise."

office: ^There is something like a statue in the corner of the room. Oh, wait. It breathes!

officeTable: ^On the office table lays a heavy registry book. Someone seems to have touched it recently.

c-0: ^You see a list of staff and students in the university

keypad: ^You have absolutely no way to know what is its passcode.

s: ^Try to figure it out a bit longer

c-0: ^I guess the real prize is the references we got along the way.

b: ^Who would have thought that zoology would be so close to astrology.
^While lucration from some liquids could be a crime, I am going to give this a pass while the murder investigation is ongoing.

Runa_cat: ^A purring cat sits on the shoulder of the young woman.
^"So, would the professor have died if no one would have opened the door?"
^"It is in a way like the question, does a falling tree make a sound if there is no one to hear it?"
^"Or would you rather hear me quote Nietzsche?"

c-0: ^"The willingness is more essential than the merit of the goal itself"
^"A thousand goals have there been so far"
c-1: ^"The universe has been recurring, and will continue to recur, for an infinite number of times across infinite time or space."

b:
^"Is there death as everything eternally returns?"

^You spot a few drops of blood on the shoulder, near the paws of the white furrball.

^"They say cats have nine lives, don't they? So does the cat gain more by taking another?"

c-2: ^"Art as the single superior counterforce against all will to negation of life."
^"So are you saying morality is good for the masses and should be left to them?"
c-3: ^"The qualities of matter are a result of an interplay of forces."
^"Are you going to burn my notes?"

c-0: ^"Were you here already when the murder took place?"
^"You'd need to define here, and also 'there'.
c-1: ^"So is the death a truly relativistic concept for you?"

b: ^"Is the question about doing or thinking more important for you than the question about being?"

Rascal: ^Almost as active as if bored out of their mind in a full lecture hall
^"They have not been letting me leave until the case is solved."

c-0: ^"Hey, its not like you are in a hurry for exams as the question source just left the mortal coil"
^You glance at a book resting on the table which seems to be about the mathematics of lunar phases.

b: ^"Hey you never know when you might need some knowledge. So better prepare while you still can"
^It seems to only concern Luna. Nothing on Europa on it. So "new world" of them.

c-1: ^"One way of getting rid of distractions is to bulldoze them out of the way."
^"You didn't happen to have a clash with the boredom stuffer?"

b: ^"You trying catching me riding dirty. But I am a survivor."
^"I might flame up but I also cool down fast"

c-2: ^"If you put such effort into studying as you put into rebelling you might get somewhere"
^"And as the System itself you are the last one to advice about rebellion"

b: ^"It is not like the teachers are any more focused than we are."
^"So be a nice little obient gear in the machine before I burst the whole thing wide open."

c-3: ^"It is going to take as long as it will take"
^"With cooperation it will take less time"

c-0: ^"Were you here already when the murder took place?"

b: ^"You wish, but I will make you sad by informing that I was away."

^"Ah don't remind me how close to eternity this torture is."

^"I was and I wish I wasn't."

c-1: ^"So did you get along with the professor?"

b: ^"Atleast our department does not extort money from us for secret drinks"

coffeetable: ^Some people are lazily biding their time.
^This seems like a good place to address a large crowd.
^Am I ready to crack this case?
Clique: ^A group of people are animatedly talking.

page1: ^The ecological meaning of quantum physics can’t be disregarded. Where chemical engineering is concerned, creation of hydrogen sulfide can be likened to be as deadly as the venom of a viper. Without a sense of smell you can be likened to exist on the digital plane, or a simulation.
page2: ^On the other way, scopolamine can be examined as a truly frightening experiment on the philosophical question on the existence of free will.
page3: ^We can wonder, what is the state of corruption in the field of financial justice. Can it be likened to infidelity in a marriage? And what would zoology be without considering the advances in understanding entanglement?
page4: ^The advances in nanotechnology suggest great possibilities for invention in the fields of engineering, medicine and computer science. Designing buildings and environments that take into account the fluctuation of water, and increased droughts and heavy rain storms is essential for a more sustainable future.
page5: ^Cooperation within fields of science and art is essential for understanding the need of a more holistic education, for truly transformative learning to happen.

b: ^Handwriting underneath reads: Maybe mix polypinkiloid with grey paint?

HallOfFame: ^The walls are lined up with various persons.
^There is a sign warning about over studying tearing you apart.

b: ^"Oh, hi Mark", you greet your buddy security guard

c-0: ^Your head is almost spinning from all the sparklies

s0: ^"This next area has some standards. Please step aside."
s2: ^"I know you are frustrated but please remain calm"

b: ^Weird way to break up a hall into multiple stories.
^Why are there spoons instead of faces in the pictures here?
^Curiously the faces here more look like each other than on the lower floor.

s0: ^"This next area has standards. Please step aside."
s2: ^"I know you are frustrated but please remain calm"

b: ^Weird way to break up a hall into multiple stories.

s2: ^"I know you are frustrated but please remain calm"

b: ^Weird way to break up a hall into multiple stories.

s0: ^"Only the best may pass. Please step aside."
s2: ^"I know you are frustrated but please remain calm"

b: ^Weird way to break up a hall into multiple stories.

CatDelivery: ^The mail room, while quite spacious, is not really spacious enough for the amount of letters in it.
^A hurried worker is sorting letters with quite some fervor.

c-0: ^"To deliver a solution to the murder mystery"
c-1: ^"For you to confess your guilt to the murder."
^"I don't have time for murders while the sorting is murdeing my hands."
c-2: ^"What do you know about the murder?"

b: ^I guess even letters knows more about murder.

task: ^"What if I don't want to sort the boxes?"
^"Then I don't want to talk with you."

c-0: ^"Do the checks required by the labels and then put them in correct chute"

taskExplain: ^"There are animals, handle with care and express"

s: ^What do I do with "handle with care"?

c-1: ^"For animals check that the transition sedation is working."
^"Then if it is not put the animal to sleep."
^"By applying the neurotoxin from that cabin."
^"That seems dangerous and not that sedative"
^"Look, this place is busy and if the sender does a failure in packaging I will get creative to keep this place running smooth"

c-0: ^"It does seem like the animals are wanted alive at their destination."
^"Look, the zoology department already does a lot of heavy packages."
^"So I will choose to interpret that they are meaning for the animals to get taxidermisised."
^"If you have a problem with that I can arrange for you to find a bear in your bed."

s: ^I would rather have a antilope in my car

c-1: ^"You just got upgraded to jaguar on your deck."

g-0: ^"We don't have infinite supplies so don't use up more of the stuff than needed."

c-2: ^"We are running low on idle hands and the chemistry deparment has gotten sloppy with their labeling"
^"So we can only afford to ship with silk gloves those that really need it"
^"To be honest I don't think the chemists would mind if some of the packages got lost if even some of them got throught"
^"The packages that actually can be thrown around you can put in 'usual treatment' "
^"and the packges that you know can not be thrown around you pur in 'snail pace'"
^"How do I determine what an take what?"
^"I don't really know and I don't really care."
c-3: ^"Just get them to their destination as fast as possible."
^"This place is so clogged that any packect moving is better than none."

s: ^"This is too complex, I am leaving"

c-0: ^"Where were you at the time of the murder?"

b: ^"If you have got time to blabber you have got time to sort the boxes"

c-1: ^"Did you get along with the murder victim?"

b: ^"If you have got time to blabber you have got time to sort the boxes"

c-1: ^"I knew his address and they always glued their stamps straigth so we are square."

b: ^"If you have got time to blabber you have got time to sort the boxes"

c-2: ^"Maybe if some of these boxes contain bombs. But I have not intentionally packaged any boms, so no."

s: ^put the box in the maybe crush machine
^put the box in the superior siege engine
^go check on whether the work is enough

b: ^An explosion throws you back to the wall.
^That level of care was not enough for you to continue living.
^"A cat is whirling inside the box"
^The cat goes limb and falls into the box.
^You might as well have used a chainsaw to destroy that pussy.
^The cat swirls into a small ball that periodically buffs and deflates.
^Machine lets out a pretty loud thud.
^But you are safe from actual harm.
^The probe came out of the machine at an angle.
^The probe came ouf of the machine straight.

^The machine spits out some bits of charred cardboard bits.

^This is all that is left of the precious postal package.

s: ^Box, what box? There was never any box here

b: ^You discretely light the cardboard box on fire

b: ^"And you were flawless about it too."

c-0: ^"Where were you when the murder took place?"

b: ^Let Merry know that if he doesn't give the Tar book back I am going to roll them in tar.

c-1: ^"Where you on good terms with the victim?"
^"We were on good enough terms that we even got married."

b: ^"They even still have me as the benefactor of their will."
^"But we grew more distant with time."

c-0: ^"Where were you when the murder took place?"

b: ^"I thought I would engage them more if I made the vaccination question deal with something cool. "

c-1: ^"Did you get along with the victim well?"

b: ^Atleast when they bothered to be around.
^I have a hard time thinking of time without them.

c-0: ^"Where were you when the murder took place?"

c-1: ^"Did you get along with the victim well?"

b: ^"He was a good colleague of mine."

s: ^No, I can do this if I put my mind into it

s: ^Accident. A really bad case of diarea.

b:

^For lack of evidence nobody is found guilty of the crime.

Win: ^All the mysteries of the universe reveal themselfs under your careful eye.
^Now go figure out the real one.

c-0: ^You step into the light through the fourth wall.
c-1: ^No. This is too fun. I think there are still mysteries to figure out about it.

s: ^I will never get bored of this

Loss: ^The mystery was too tough a nut to crack.
^The misleading theories allowed for the perpatrator to hide so well they were not found.
^Having meddled in so important matters beyond your duties
^the university doesn't renew your work contract.

b:
^You went home.

^Before you got inside a jaguar jumped on you.

^With your puny unmotivated human hands you had no chance to win the fight.

^You die.

^You went and slept it off.

^Next days newspaper had a big article of the impenetrable mystery of the murder.

^Your performance grade for that day was F.

^Apparently they don't like blood on their floors.

^Your day begins a totally unconnected adventure.
